text: My general comment is that we need more text in the example, and less in the narrative docs.

I would like the narrative much more reduced. It should be a paragraph, with a simple pointer to the example. On the other hand, the example should have all the text that are currently in the narrative to make it a full tutorial with discussions in it.

Merging!

Great job.

> My general comment is that we need more text in the example, and less in the narrative docs.

I guess that is what I have done. I kept narrative docs simple without code snippets.
In example a bit more.
a chain of image operations to do from the input data to a mask over specific targets of interest
title: (None, '', u'doc/manipulating_images/manipulating_images.rst')

text: These chains of operations are easy to set up using Nilearn and Scipy Python libraries. Here we give clear guidelines about these steps, starting with pre-image operations to post-image operations. The main point is that  visualization & results checking be possible at each step.
title: (None, '', u'doc/manipulating_images/manipulating_images.rst')

text: We rely on the Haxby dataset to demonstrate the complete list of operations.

text: We should probably avoid to use _utils stuff in examples, shouldn't we? The rationale being that _utils stuff should only be used within nilearn and not by end-users. I would say nibabel.load is probably fine.
title: (None, '', u'examples/04_manipulating_images/plot_roi_extraction.py')

text:
> We should probably avoid to use _utils stuff in examples, shouldn't we, the
> rationale being that _utils stuff should only be used within nilearn and not by
> end-users. I would say nibabel.load is probably fine.

+1: this is an advanced example, it's good to teach nibabel to these
users.

text: Actually, I think that it would be a good thing to make `masking._load_mask_img` public. On top of loading mask from strings and converting to boolean, it make necessary checks like dimensionality and number of unique values.
title: (None, '', u'examples/04_manipulating_images/plot_roi_extraction.py')

text:
> Actually, I think that it would be a good thing to make masking._load_mask_img
> public. On top of loading mask from strings and converting to boolean, it make
> necessary checks like dimensionality and number of unique values.

Right, but it's a fairly specific function. And I worry about having a
too big public API: it makes things harder to find.
